solution_04_inferential_statistics/05_exam4/01_one_mean_ci_pval_v2

\[n=12\] \[\text{df}=11 \]

\[t^\star = 2.2\] \[\bar{x} = 600.2458\] \[s = 0.4695\]

\[\text{CI}_\text{bounds} = \bar{x}\pm \frac{t^\star s}{\sqrt{n}} \]

\[\text{CI}_\text{bounds} = \text{(599.948, 600.544)}\]

\[t=\frac{\bar{x}-\mu_0}{s/\sqrt{n}}=\frac{600.2458-600}{0.4695/ \sqrt{12}}\] \[t = 1.814\] \[p\text{-value}= P\left(|T|>1.814\right) \] \[p\text{-value} = 0.097 \]


  1. 599.9475052
  2. 600.5441615
  3. 0.0970702
  4. The p-value is more than 0.05, so the difference is NOT significant. /
